lines.text: Agnes, call me a cab.
Huh?
Call me a cab.
You're a cab.

[to Stan who is dressed as the maid]
Pardon me, are you of any relation to the butler?
Oh, yes, yes, they're twins. You see, one was born in Detroit, the other in Mee-a-mee.
[Laughs]
I don't quite understand.
Oh, that's all right. Neither do they.
[Laughs]
Well, here's another nice mess you've gotten me into.

[as Agnes the Maid]
Bedrooms, let's see, there's mine and the master's and the master's and mine. That's four.
No no, there's the master's then yours. That's two.
Oh, yeah. Then there's the nursery.
A nursery? I didn't know the colonel was married.
Oh, he has that in case of accidents.
I beg your pardon, Lord Figtree!
Plumtree, my dear fellow, Plumtree. My card.
Agnes, how long have you been here?

[in drag as the maid]
About half an hour.
[realizing what she has said]
Oh, heh!
[laughs]
How silly of me! I'm so nervous. Heh, I mean half a year - to be exact, three months!
By the way, Colonel, do you have any horses?

[posing as Colonel Buckshot]
I'm sorry... I shipped all of my horses to my plantation in Kentucky.
Kentucky? What part of Kentucky do you come from, Colonel?

[fondly and grandly]
Omaha... dear old Omaha!
I thought Omaha was in Wisconsin.
Oh, Agnes - - meet your new master, Lord Flagpole Crabtree.
PLUMtree... PLUMtree! Lord Leopold PLUMtree! My cahd.
That's RIGHT!
Ahhh... at last I have found it, Lord Appletree!
PLUMtree... PLUMtree! Lord Leopold PLUMtree! Accent on the "LUM". My cahd.
[He reaches in his pocket for another card, but accidentally takes out three cards at once, which he hands to Hardy]

[leafing through the cards and reading them off one-by-one]
"Plumtree"... "Plumtree"... "Plumtree"... I am terribly sorry.

[posing as the butler]
You wish to see Colonel Buckshot?
Why, I'd LOVE to! Hauw-haw-haw-huh-huh-huh-huh!

[turning away and calling toward the stairway]
Colonel Buckshot!
[a few seconds pass with no answer]
Oh, Ollie - - uh - - Colonel Buckshot!
[No answer]

[speaking to Lord Plumtree and his wife]
Wait there.
[He walks several yards to the foot of the stairs, then cups his hand to his mouth and hollers up the stairs]
Colonel BUCKshot...
[using his classic shrill whistle]
... HHREEE-YER-REEET!

[posing as Colonel Buckshot]
What is it, Hives?

[wincing at the derogatory name Hardy has chosen for him]
Lord Appletree - - he wants to rent a room.
No, no, my dear fellow - - 'PLUMtree'. 'PLUMtree'. Lord Leopold 'Plumtree' - - my card. And I wish to rent the entire HOUSE.
[inspects the new card that Lord Plumtree has given him, then absently tosses the first card away]

[shaking his hand in surprise and pain after the brace holding up the lid of the piano vibrates loose and the lid falls shut and pinches Lord Plumtree's finger]
Oh, I say! I SAY!
Oh, I beg your pardon, Lord Figtree!
'PLUMtree!' 'PLUMtree'! Lord Leopold 'Plumtree'!
[He hands Hardy another card]
Ah, a thousand pardons - - my mistake!
Say, Kelly, did a couple of bozos come through here?
Yeah, a couple just ran in there, why?

Well, they was trying to make a HOTEL out of the city park - - they had even put a couple of benches together so they could have twin beds! And when I told them to move on, the little fella tips his hat and says "yes ma'am." That's what I'm sore about!

[after finding that they have gotten locked into Colonel Buckshot's celler by the doors' outside latch-hooks falling shut]
Well - - here's ANOTHER nice mess you've gotten me into...! "Yes, **MA'AM**"...! Of all the idiotic - -
[disgustedly takes a half-hearted swing at Laurel]
Just a second! I forgot my bow and arrow!

[to Stan]
Come on! Let's reconoiter.
